```lean4
import Mathlib

open Nat Set MeasureTheory Topology Filter

/--
Let $p > 1$ be an integer with the property that $x^2 - x + p$ is prime for all $x$ in the range $0 < x < p$. Show there exists exactly one triple of integers $a,b,c$ satisfying $b^2 - 4ac = 1 - 4p$, $0 < a \leq c$, and $-a \leq b < a$.
-/
theorem putnam_1973_b3
(p : ℕ)
(pgt1 : p > 1)
(hprime : ∀ x ∈ Set.Ico 0 p, Nat.Prime (x^2 - x + p))
: ∃! triple : ℤ × ℤ × ℤ, let (a,b,c) := triple; b^2 - 4*a*c = 1 - 4*p ∧ 0 < a ∧ a ≤ c ∧ -a ≤ b ∧ b < a :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1973_b3
(p : ℕ)
(pgt1 : p > 1)
(hprime : ∀ x ∈ Set.Ico 0 p, Nat.Prime (x^2 - x + p))
: ∃! triple : ℤ × ℤ × ℤ, let (a,b,c) := triple; b^2 - 4*a*c = 1 - 4*p ∧ 0 < a ∧ a ≤ c ∧ -a ≤ b ∧ b < a := by
  use (1, -1, 1)
  constructor
  · have h₁ := hprime 0
    have h₂ := hprime 1
    have h₃ := hprime (p - 1)
    have h₄ := hprime p
    simp_all [Set.mem_Ico, Nat.Prime]
    <;> omega
  · rintro ⟨a, b, c⟩ ⟨h₁, h₂, h₃, h₄, h₅⟩
    have h₆ := hprime 0
    have h₇ := hprime 1
    have h₈ := hprime (p - 1)
    have h₉ := hprime p
    simp_all [Set.mem_Ico, Nat.Prime]
    <;>
    (try omega) <;>
    (try nlinarith) <;>
    (try
      nlinarith [sq_nonneg (a - 1), sq_nonneg (b + 1), sq_nonneg (c - 1), sq_nonneg (a + b), sq_nonneg (a - c), sq_nonneg (b - a), sq_nonneg (c - a), sq_nonneg (c + b)])
```

import Mathlib

open Real Nat Topology MeasureTheory
open scoped BigOperators

theorem putnam_1973_b3
(p : ℕ)
(pgt1 : p > 1)
(hprime : ∀ x ∈ Set.Ico 0 p, Nat.Prime (x^2 - x + p))
: ∃! triple : ℤ × ℤ × ℤ, let (a,b,c) := triple; b^2 - 4*a*c = 1 - 4*p ∧ 0 < a ∧ a ≤ c ∧ -a ≤ b ∧ b < a := by
  use (1, -1, 1)
  constructor
  · have h₁ := hprime 0
    have h₂ := hprime 1
    have h₃ := hprime (p - 1)
    have h₄ := hprime p
    simp_all [Set.mem_Ico, Nat.Prime]
    <;> omega
  · rintro ⟨a, b, c⟩ ⟨h₁, h₂, h₃, h₄, h₅⟩
    have h₆ := hprime 0
    have h₇ := hprime 1
    have h₈ := hprime (p - 1)
    have h₉ := hprime p
    simp_all [Set.mem_Ico, Nat.Prime]
    <;>
    (try omega) <;>
    (try nlinarith) <;>
    (try
      nlinarith [sq_nonneg (a - 1), sq_nonneg (b + 1), sq_nonneg (c - 1), sq_nonneg (a + b), sq_nonneg (a - c), sq_nonneg (b - a), sq_nonneg (c - a), sq_nonneg (c + b)])

theorem putnam_1973_b3
(p : ℕ)
(pgt1 : p > 1)
(hprime : ∀ x ∈ Set.Ico 0 p, Nat.Prime (x^2 - x + p))
: ∃! triple : ℤ × ℤ × ℤ, let (a,b,c) := triple; b^2 - 4*a*c = 1 - 4*p ∧ 0 < a ∧ a ≤ c ∧ -a ≤ b ∧ b < a := by
  use (1, -1, 1)

  · constructor
    · norm_num
      <;> ring_nf
      <;> norm_num [Nat.Prime] at hprime ⊢
      <;> nlinarith [hprime 0 (by norm_num), hprime 1 (by norm_num)]
    · norm_num
  · rintro ⟨a, b, c⟩ ⟨h1, h2, h3, h4, h5⟩
    have h6 : a = 1 := by
      have h7 : 0 < a := by linarith
      have h8 : a ≤ 1 := by
        nlinarith [sq_nonneg (b + 1), sq_nonneg (b - 1), sq_nonneg (c - 1), sq_nonneg (c + 1)]
      linarith
    have h7 : b = -1 := by
      have h8 : b ≥ -1 := by linarith
      have h9 : b ≤ 0 := by
        nlinarith [sq_nonneg (b + 1), sq_nonneg (b - 1), sq_nonneg (c - 1), sq_nonneg (c + 1)]
      have h10 : b ≤ 0 := by linarith
      have h11 : b ≥ -1 := by linarith
      have h12 : b = -1 := by
        nlinarith [sq_nonneg (b + 1), sq_nonneg (b - 1), sq_nonneg (c - 1), sq_nonneg (c + 1)]
      linarith
    have h8 : c = 1 := by
      have h9 : c ≥ 1 := by linarith
      have h10 : c ≤ 1 := by
        nlinarith [sq_nonneg (b + 1), sq_nonneg (b - 1), sq_nonneg (c - 1), sq_nonneg (c + 1)]
      linarith
    simp_all
    <;> omega

    · norm_num
      <;> ring_nf

      <;> nlinarith [hprime 0 (by norm_num), hprime 1 (by norm_num)]
    · norm_num
  · rintro ⟨a, b, c⟩ ⟨h1, h2, h3, h4, h5⟩
    have h6 : a = 1 := by
      have h7 : 0 < a := by linarith
      have h8 : a ≤ 1 := by
